author: Special Correspondent
text:
Pragyan, an annual international Techno-Management fest of NIT-T, will begin on its campus on Friday.

The four-day festival will witness a number of events ranging from panel discussion to guest lectures and infotainment to star night. With teams from over 60 countries taking part in the contests, Pragyan hosts more than 40 events spanning across eight genres. Apart from the prize money, these events provide a platform to learn, compete, and have fun.

S. Sundarrajan, Director, NIT-T, said the varied exhibitions would display metal mate robotics, automated chess, IOT based BOLT, smart vehicles, ISRO exhibits, defence exhibits, and so on. Along with this, the students of NIT-T, under the banner of ‘Sangam’, would display models developed by them on various problems. For the first time, Pragyan had invited exhibits from students from across Indian college for Anwesh, an inter-college exhibitions series.

Sudhir Mishra, CEO and MD, BRAHMOS Aerospace, would be among those invited for delivering guest lectures. There would be a panel discussion, aimed at providing a global platform for the academia, industry, and government to interact with the fraternity.

Pragyan’16 would witness a panel discussion with Bahar Dutt, former Environment Editor, CNN-IBN), Nawshir Mirza, Board of Directors, Tata Power, Anoop Poonia, Program Officer, CAN South Asia, A. Ravindra, Chairman, Center of Sustainable Development.

The moderator will be Abhinandan Sekhri.

There would be an interaction between popular troupe The Viral Fever and past Indian cricketing captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth during Pragyan's Star Night.
title: NIT-T’s Pragyan from February 26
